_description: Urban context algorithm definitions for UCID library.

contexts.name: 15-Minute City
contexts.description: Measures accessibility to essential services within 15 minutes by foot or bike. Based on the urban planning concept proposed by Carlos Moreno.

contexts.name: Transit Accessibility
contexts.description: Measures public transportation accessibility based on stop density, route frequency, and coverage area. Uses GTFS data when available.

contexts.name: Walkability
contexts.description: Measures pedestrian infrastructure quality including sidewalk coverage, intersection density, and pedestrian amenities.

contexts.name: No Context
contexts.description: Default context when no specific urban context scoring is applied. UCID contains only location information.

contexts.name: Climate Resilience
contexts.description: Assesses urban climate adaptation and resilience metrics including green space ratio and flood risk.

contexts.name: Social Equity
contexts.description: Measures equitable access to resources and opportunities across different demographic groups.

contexts.name: Urban Vitality
contexts.description: Measures economic activity, business density, and urban vibrancy indicators.

contexts.name: Public Safety
contexts.description: Assesses safety and security metrics including crime rates and emergency response times.
